body.name: MSI MPG A1000G PCIE 5 & ATX 3.0 Gaming Power Supply - Full Modular - 80 Plus Gold Certified 1000W - 100% Japanese 105°C Capacitors - Compact Size - ATX PSU
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 1 hr 8 mins
features: 10-year limited warranty, guaranteeing long term reliable operation
body.description: The MPG gaming power supply is proudly backed by a 10-year limited warranty, guaranteeing long term reliable operation. Aiming for unwavering product quality and performance stability, the MPG gaming power supply comes with 100% Japanese 105° C capacitors and solid capacitors. Organizing cables is often the most bothersome part of building a PC. With the MPG gaming power supply’s fully modular design, it means that only the connectors required by the build need to be used, significantly reducing cable clutter and simplifying the system’s overall build.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.6 4.6 out of 5 stars 2,044 ratings 4.6 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: LEVEL UP YOUR GAME With a native 16 PIN PCIe connector the power supply is ready for next gen graphics cards. It can generate up to 600W of power to PCIe 5.0 graphics cards.

ATX 3.0 COMPATIBLE It has an output port that is compliant with PCIe 5.0 and Intel PSDG (Power Supply Design Guide) ATX 3.0. The power supply can hold up to 2x total power excursion and 3x GPU power excursion.
80 PLUS GOLD CERTIFIED The 80 PLUS Gold certification promises lower energy consumption and higher efficiency.

SINGLE-RAILED DESIGN The single-rail supply of power can properly deliver the power you need. This power supply's 5 CPU & PCI-E slots are more than plenty for high-performance graphics cards and CPUs.

GPU SUPPORT FOR ALL The MPG Series power supplies support both NVIDIA and AMD graphics cards. The power supplies' IO ports can support many versatile ways of connection depending on different graphics card designs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptional Performance and Modular Design!
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded my gaming rig with the MSI MPG A1000G PCIe 5 Gaming Power Supply, and it has exceeded my expectations in every way. This power supply is an absolute beast, and here's why I'm giving it a 5-star review:Reliable Power Delivery: The 80 Plus Gold certification ensures high efficiency and stable power delivery to all my components. I've never experienced any power-related issues since installing it.Silent Operation: The power supply operates almost silently, even under heavy gaming loads. It's a night-and-day difference compared to my old PSU, and it keeps my setup nice and quiet.Full Modular Design: The full modular design is a game-changer for cable management. I only connect the cables I need, reducing clutter and improving airflow inside my case. This is a boon for anyone obsessed with aesthetics.Ample Power: With a 1000W capacity, this power supply easily handles my high-end GPU and CPU. I have room for future upgrades without worrying about power constraints.Stylish Aesthetics: The design of the power supply complements my gaming setup perfectly. The MSI logo and the overall build quality are top-notch.PCIe 5 Support: Being PCIe 5 compatible is a forward-thinking feature. While I don't have a PCIe 5 motherboard yet, I appreciate that this power supply is ready for future technology.ATX 3.0 Compliance: The ATX 3.0 specification ensures compatibility with modern motherboards, and I had no issues with installation.In conclusion, the MSI MPG A1000G PCIe 5 Gaming Power Supply is a fantastic addition to any gaming rig. It combines top-tier performance, quiet operation, and a sleek design. It's a bit on the pricey side, but the peace of mind and reliability it offers make it worth every penny. If you're serious about your gaming setup, this power supply should be at the top of your list. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: MSI MPG A850G PCIE 5It combines top tier A performance, quiet operation, and a sleek design. The peace of mind and reliability it offers make it worth every penny. If you're serious about your gaming setup, this power supply should be at the top of your list.This PSU pairs great with my MSI Z690-A motherboard. The 850 provides more than enough power to my graphics card (3080) and CPU (12900k), even while overclocking. This PSU easily fits inside a midsize tower and runs very quietly.Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Minus the cables, PSU working beautifully.
reviews.reviewText: Had a 750w psu in a prebuilt (IBP) which was awful and just upgraded to the 850w A850G and my goodness what a difference. Quiet, powerful and have no complaints. Was a bit iffy at first due to all the negative reviews but seems like I got a good one! Without a doubt would recommend.Minor con - The cables are soooo stiff and pretty ugly but if you don't mind the looks and a bit of forceful bending then its all good lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Power Supply
reviews.reviewText: What can I say other than its a great PSU, quiet, easy to install. No issues with shipping, package came secure. Has a fishy smell when you first open it but it goes away fairly quickly! Honestly it looks rad with the dragon logo on the side.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Powerful, quiet, with a 10 year warranty!
reviews.reviewText: MSI makes quality stuff. My old PC, now 10 years old, has MSI parts that have never failed, so I got even more MSI parts this time around. This PSU has more power than I currently need. I probably could've done an 850. It is very quiet - at least, I can't hear it above the quiet hum of my giant 200mm fans. And this unit has a 10 year warranty. That is the best in the industry, I believe. I like that it is fully modular, so only the cables I need are plugged in.Full disclosure: I made a build mistake and thought I got a defective unit, so did a refund with Amazon before I did a bench test of this PSU, found it worked fine, and then rehooked it up to my PC. The new unit is the one I'll be sending back to Amazon, unopened, because the first one was fine. The only thing I can think of is that, although I checked every cable three times, the power switch connector may not have been fully seated on my MoBo. My case has this weird tiny box around all of those small molex connectors for power, reset, etc. which bundles them together, making them easier to attach to the MoBo, but each one can move a bit inside that box. So it was possible that while the box itself was all the way down when I checked, that the power switch's molex connector was not.Anyway, once that I figured that out, everything has been great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I recommend it!
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. I am loving this PSU. Its quiet, was easy to install and put together. Best part is my pc is running smoothly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No news is good news
reviews.reviewText: In an ideal world, you never think about your PSU, and this one is pretty ideal! Plugged it in, it works. I bought it to pre-empt upgrading some other components, but haven't done that yet so it's a 1000 W PSU powering a system that was completely stable with a 500 W PSU. Case fans and spinning disks are louder than the fan on the PSU (and I have the quite mode or whatever enabled) so I have literally never noticed it.It fits in my case, uses the standard mounting points, comes with a good number of cables, and is overall just what I want from a PSU.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great power supply; came with 12V-2x6
reviews.reviewText: Powerful power supply at a decent price. It was very easy to install, especially since you only have to plug in the cables you need.I was surprised to see my unit (MPG A850G) came with the brand new 12V-2x6 connector, since it only just recently "replaced" the 12VHPWR standard; a very nice addition, and one that wasn't advertised anywhere.My only nitpick is, if your current GPU uses one 8-pin PCIe connector, like my 3060 Ti, then the other PCIe 6+2 plug will just have to hang around loose next to your card, as in my picture.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent choice for anyone building a high-end PC setup.
reviews.reviewText: The MSI MPG A1000G PCIE 5.0, 80+ Gold Full Modular Gaming PSU is a high-performance power supply unit designed to meet the demands of high-end gaming rigs, especially those equipped with the latest GPUs like the RTX 4080 and 4090. Awarding it a commendable 4 out of 5 stars, let's delve into the specifics that make it stand out, as well as areas that could see improvement.Performance and Compatibility: The 1000W output is more than capable of supporting the most power-hungry components, making it a perfect match for gamers and professionals looking to build a top-tier system. The inclusion of a 12VHPWR cable and compatibility with ATX 3.0 standards ensures it's ready for next-gen graphics cards, future-proofing your setup.Efficiency and Reliability: With an 80+ Gold efficiency rating, the MPG A1000G is designed to deliver clean and reliable power while maintaining high energy efficiency. This not only helps in reducing electricity costs but also ensures less heat generation. The use of 100% Japanese 105°C capacitors speaks volumes about its build quality and reliability, promising longevity and stable performance under heavy loads.Design and Modularity: The full modular design is a significant plus, allowing for a clean and organized build by using only the cables you need. This feature enhances airflow within the chassis and makes the setup process smoother and more aesthetically pleasing. Its compact size is also noteworthy, accommodating even mid-sized cases without compromising on power.Noise Level: One of the standout features is its quiet operation. Even under considerable load, the PSU maintains a low noise level, thanks to a well-designed cooling system. This is particularly important for users who prioritize a silent working or gaming environment.Considerations: While the MSI MPG A1000G excels in many areas, the premium price point may be a consideration for some. Additionally, while it supports the latest technology, ensuring your components are compatible is crucial, as the cutting-edge features may not be fully utilized in older systems.Overall: The MSI MPG A1000G PCIE 5.0 PSU is an excellent choice for anyone building a high-end PC setup. Its robust power output, future-proof features, and reliable performance justify its rating. The high efficiency, coupled with the quality of components, makes it a solid investment for serious gamers and professionals. While the cost may be on the higher side, the value it brings to a modern, powerful PC build cannot be overstated.

The MPG A850G PCIE5 is newbie-friendly power supply to use for my first higher-end build.It met my criteria for having enough wattage for my higher-end build that can also be useful for future builds. It also has helpful energy efficiency thanks to the ATX 3.0 standard handling spikes so that I can rest easy with stability. The 12VHPWR connector is also convenient to have for any future GPU upgrades that may utilize it.One last thing to note, it it is able to connect to GPUs that require 3 PCIe connectors. The recommended configuration is to use the 12VHPWR to 2 PCIe connector cable and one PCIe connector cable. This is one of the reasons I chose to get this PSU as my GPU needed it.

es de las mejores fuentes que he comprado, lo que me decepciono de amazon fue que me movieron la fecha de entrega y no me avisaron por correo solo me enviaron publicidad de amazon, tardaron 1 mes en enviarla.

No soy muy versado en cuanto al tema de fuentes de poder, pero el empaque con el que viene es muy premium, se siente la calidad al tan solo cargar la caja y luego abrirla y que al tacto se siente de buenos materiales, en cuanto a su rendimiento no me causa problemas, aunque cabe señalar que la compre sobrada ya wue con una 700w creo me bastaba.

Sin duda es una de las mejores compras que se puede hacer en este ámbito, la fuente es muy linda, la calidad de los cables es muy buena, las conexiones igual, tiene una gran capacidad y no hace nada de ruido, si piensas comprarla para tenerla mucho tiempo sin duda es tu mejor opción además del soporte que tiene para las nuevas gráficas y placas es excelente (no pongo más fotos porque está instalada)
